https://www.acba.am/en/news/IFC-cooperat.title_en: Acba bank to Allocate $50 Million for MSME Development
https://www.acba.am/en/news/IFC-cooperat.content_en:
As a result  of a new collaboration between Acba bank and the International Finance Corporation (IFC), Acba bank will allocate $50 million to finance and develop micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in Armenia.
Through this new partnership, IFC will share the credit return risk for loans provided by Acba bank, covering up to 50% of the $50 million portfolio. This collaboration will allow Acba bank to further expand its financing for MSMEs across Armenia.
"This new partnership with IFC is a significant project aimed at supporting micro, small, and medium enterprises. The program is about  sharing risks—IFC's support allows us to be bolder and more active in financing MSMEs. I believe we can rapidly allocate these funds," said Hakob Andreasyan, CEO of Acba bank.
"This risk-sharing partnership with Acba bank is vital for Armenia as it promotes the sustainable and inclusive development of the country. Through this project, we aim to support MSME financing in Armenia, particularly by addressing challenges they face in attracting financial resources. It is crucial that women-owned enterprises also benefit from this partnership, as financing barriers are especially prominent among women-owned SMEs, rural areas, and agribusinesses," noted Marcelo Castellanos, IFC’s Senior Regional Manager for the Financial Institutions Group in Europe.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/American-Exp.title_en: Acba bank and American Express Expand Collaboration in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/American-Exp.content_en:
Acba bank and American Express have announced an expansion of their long-standing agreement which grants Acba the license to issue American Express Cards and acquire American Express-accepting merchants. Acba bank has been American Express’ exclusive licensee in Armenia since 2009.Acba bank issues three American Express Cards in Armenia: the American Express® Gold Card, the American Express® Blue Card, and the American Express® Debit Card. Local American Express® Debit Card Members can earn cashback and local American Express® Blue and Gold Card Members can earn Membership Rewards® points on every spend. Local American Express® Gold Card Members can specifically enjoy access to more than 1400 airport lounges worldwide, comprehensive insurance and assistance as well as a range of exclusive offers1.Through this agreement, Acba bank aims to continue increasing the number of locations that accept American Express in Armenia and continuing to service American Express Card Members in the country.   The signing ceremony for the renewal agreement took place at American Express’ headquarters in New York City (United States of America) with Hakob Andreasyan, Chief Executive Officer of Acba bank, and Briana Wilsey, Vice President and General Manager of Global Network Services EMEA at American Express.American Express is a globally integrated payments company. American Express has 140+ million cards in circulation and more than 89 million merchants accept American Express payments worldwide2.Acba is one of the leading banks in Armenia. Acba bank is regulated by the Central Bank of Armenia.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/1731394780.title_en: ACBA Bank allocates AMD bonds with an annual yield of 10.5%
https://www.acba.am/en/news/1731394780.content_en:
Acba bank has launched a public offering of non-documentary coupon bonds with a total volume of AMD 5,000,000,000 (five billion).
The bank will allocate AMD 50,000 (fifty thousand) bonds with an annual yield of 10.5%.
The bonds will have a maturity of 60 months, the placement will start on November 11, 2024 and will last until December 2, inclusive.
The nominal value of one bond is AMD 100,000 (one hundred thousand).
To purchase bonds, the investor must fill out and submit to Acba bank an application for the purchase of bonds.
Bond purchase application for individuals:
Purchase application for AMD bonds
Bond purchase application for legal entities:
Purchase application for AMD bonds
According to the RA Law “On Guaranteeing Compensation of Bank deposits”, funds attracted by nominal bonds issued by the Bank are considered a guaranteed bank deposit and are guaranteed by the “Deposit Guarantee Fund”. The bank is supervised by the RA Central Bank.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/DFC-cooperat.title_en: 50 Million USD will be Allocated to Business Development in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/DFC-cooperat.content_en:
Acba bank is the first in Armenia to partner with the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC). As a result of this partnership, 50 million USD will be allocated to support micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in Armenia and stimulate economic growth.
At least 50% of the funds will be allocated to businesses owned by women, creating special opportunities for their development.
“This is the first time that DFC has signed an agreement with an Armenian organization, specifically Acba bank. We will direct the received resources towards the development of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises in our country. Special emphasis will be placed on the role of women in these businesses, and a significant amount of the funds will be allocated to the development of businesses led by women. With this cooperation, we will contribute to the continuous development of businesses throughout Armenia," noted Hakob Andreasyan, CEO at Acba bank.
“Today, we celebrate the important partnership between Armenia and the United States. Our collaboration with Acba bank is about our shared values and fostering economic growth in Armenia. Small businesses are the engine of a free market, creating jobs and opportunities for communities. The U.S. International Development Finance Corporation uses its tools and authorities to provide access to finance that will help grow Armenian businesses and propel Armenia’s economy forward," said Nisha Biswal, Deputy CEO of the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation
"This is the largest ever investment in Armenia by the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation, which is being received by Acba bank. I believe this is an important step in expanding access to financing for small and medium-sized enterprises. This will allow local businesses to grow, innovate, and create new jobs," said U.S. Ambassador to Armenia Christina Quinn.
"This cooperation not only supports small and medium-sized enterprises in Armenia but also marks another significant step towards further deepening economic relations between the United States and Armenia. This lending program will help Armenian businesses expand, develop, and become more competitive in both local and international markets," said Deputy Minister of Economy of Armenia, Arman Khojoyan.
"Acba bank is one of the leaders of our banking system and has demonstrated stable financial indicators for many years. The Bank has introduced the best standards, especially in the field of corporate governance, and has been alongside Armenian businesses, the agricultural sector, and SMEs for many years. Acba bank's experienced specialists have become partners and advisors to this business community, standing by our businesses from the beginning of their initiatives to their successful completion," said Davit Nahapetyan, a Board member of the Central Bank of Armenia.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/business-tra.title_en: Digital Business Transformation: where to start and how?
https://www.acba.am/en/news/business-tra.content_en:
At the regular meeting of the Acba Business Club, the businessmen discussed key issues related to business development, digitization, identified challenges and assessed potential risks.
"Digital transformation of business: where to start and how?" was the key point of discussion at the event. The special guest of Acba Business Club was Hayk Karapetyan, CEO of Ozon Company in Armenia and co-founder of SatisfiAi Company. Through his own experience, Hayk shared valuable insights on the appropriate strategies for business digitization with the attendees.
 
"Thank you for the invitation to Acba Business Club to share my experience. The format was very engaging, allowing for direct discussions with fellow businessmen and a valuable exchange of insights. We were able to learn from each other's experiences and hear compelling stories of business transformations. The networking aspect was also beneficial, as it provided an opportunity for businessmen to connect and potentially create additional value for their companies," shared Hayk Karapetyan, CEO of Ozon Company in Armenia and co-founder of SatisfiAI Company.
Acba is the first in the banking system to establish a business club in order to develop entrepreneurship and create a new business culture, bringing together the Armenian business community as a vital platform for sharing insights and engaging in discussions on business-related matters.
 
Under the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers have access to resources that can help them acquire essential knowledge and tools for effective management, build new business relationships, and become part of the business community. Within the framework of the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers can:
attend free business courses,
become a member of Acba Business Club,
use the possibilities of the sme.acba.am online business platform,
make your own products more recognizable by participating in the "Made by our partners" project
 
Acba Business Club is a platform for SME managers to network, attend themed events, be in the focus of business events, as well as take advantage of special offers provided by partner organizations.
Acba Business Club marks the start of new perspectives and opportunities for businesses.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/EIB-cooperat.title_en: EIB Global signs first direct loan agreement  with an Armenian commercial bank
https://www.acba.am/en/news/EIB-cooperat.content_en:
The European Investment Bank’s global arm, EIB Global, is lending Armenia-based Acba bank €55 million to expand financing for micro, small and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) as well as mid-caps in the country. The transaction is EIB Global’s first direct credit line to a commercial bank in Armenia.
The loan builds on the strengthened commitment of EIB Global to support economic development and stimulate private-sector growth and job creation in Armenia. EIB Global’s financing will be channelled by Acba bank at affordable rates to the local private sector, bolstering economic development and spurring investments. More than 200 MSMEs, with a focus on women-led businesses, are expected to benefit from the operation, sustaining over 6,000 jobs.
“We are delighted to establish this new partnership with Acba bank,” said Teresa Czerwińska, EIB vice-president responsible operations in Armenia.  “Our aim is to contribute to building stronger and resilient economies that create jobs. This loan will contribute to the growth and competitiveness of Armenian MSMEs, including those in the country's rural areas, and will promote entrepreneurship in line with the priorities of the European Union and Armenia.”
The initiative is part of EIB Global’s Armenia MSME Resilience Facility, which aims to increase access to finance for the private sector in the country. The Facility promotes long-term economic resilience by providing financing to local enterprises through Armenian banks.
“We are committed to assuring banks that the loan conditions, bolstered by an EU grant for local currency support, will be highly attractive. As we finalize the grant under Neighbourhood Investment Platform (NIP), this initiative will complement the EIB's own risk operations, enhancing financial accessibility and support for local businesses," said Jan Plešinger, Chargé d’Affaires a.i. of the EU Delegation to Armenia.
The operation contributes to the EU’s goal of supporting 30,000 MSMEs for a sustainable, innovative and competitive economy as one of the five pillars for Armenia under the Economic and Investment Plan for the Eastern Partnership.
"Acba bank is currently launching the first direct and large-scale collaboration in Armenia with the European Investment Bank by securing €55 million. Acba is one of the leading funders of small, medium, and large enterprises across Armenia, and this funding will allow us to provide an additional boost to the development of MSMEs. Fostering the development of MSMEs is a primary goal for us, as they are considered the driving force of our country's economy," said Hakob Andreasyan, CEO of Acba bank.About the EIB and EIB Global
The EIB is the long-term financing institution of the European Union, owned by the Member States. It provides long-term finance for sound investments in pursuit of EU policy goals, supporting projects in four priority areas: infrastructure, innovation, climate and environment, and SMEs.
EIB Global is the EIB Group’s specialised arm devoted to increasing the impact of international partnerships and development finance, contributing to the three overarching priorities of the European Union: the European Green Deal, the Global Gateway and jobs, and sustainable and inclusive growth. Within Team Europe, EIB Global fosters strong, focused partnerships alongside fellow development finance institutions and civil society, in close cooperation with other multilateral development banks. EIB Global brings the EIB Group closer to local people, companies and institutions through our offices around the world including the EIB Regional Representation for the South Caucasus covering Armenia.
About Acba bank
Acba bank is one of the leaders of the Armenian banking system, the absolute leader in financing the country's rural sector. After the initial public offering (IPO) in 2021, Acba bank has more than 5,600 shareholders. Thanks to the implementation of the latest digital solutions and the use of new technologies, the bank continuously develops the quantity and quality of the provided financial services. Acba is represented in all regions of Armenia, has 65 branches, and is considered one of the largest employers in the financial system and the country.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/gyumri.title_en: Shirak" branch of Acba bank will operate at a new address in Gyumri
https://www.acba.am/en/news/gyumri.content_en:
Acba bank's "Shirak" branch, equipped with new and modern solutions, will operate in Gyumri at the new Abovyan 256 address (next to the Church of the Holy Saviour).
 
Acba bank will provide all the services offered by the bank to all its clients and partners in the "Shirak" branch operating at the new address.

With the positive changes in Gyumri, the demand for banking services is expected to increase, and we are committed to supporting Gyumri's development through our services," stated Hakob Andreasyan, CEO of Acba bank.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/energy-effic.title_en: Acba bank contributes to the development of energy efficiency in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/energy-effic.content_en:
Acba bank offered flexible financing choices for energy-efficient and energy-saving products to both businesses and individuals during the energy efficiency expo hosted by the "German Savings Banks Foundation for International Cooperation" in Ijevan.
 
During the energy efficiency expo, products such as Armenian-made water heaters, electric boilers, heated floors, and other energy-efficient solar solutions were presented.
 
"We are glad that Acba bank joined this event. Armenia has so much sun that positions the country well to make significant advancements in the field of green energy production in the coming years.  In that way, Acba bank stands by the residents, offering interesting financial solutions so that people can take advantage of the advantages of "green" technologies," said Eric Böttcher, head of the Armenian representative office of the German Savings Banks Association.
 
This year Acba bank was recognized as the best in Armenia by ESG (environmental, social and governance) standards by the Euromoney financial magazine, taking into account the steady growth of the bank's loan portfolio and its growing share in the ESG framework. Taking into account the international best practices, Acba has developed and will soon implement its own procedures for issuing "green" loans, through which the criteria for "green" loans and the mechanisms for calculating CO2 emissions will be defined.
 
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/euromoney.title_en: Acba Bank is the Best in Armenia According to ESG Standards. Euromoney
https://www.acba.am/en/news/euromoney.content_en:
The renowned British financial publication, Euromoney, has recognized Acba bank as Armenia's "Best ESG-Bank" within the Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) framework. 
This honorable recognition highlights Acba bank's consistent loan portfolio growth and its increasing integration within the ESG framework. Key factors include the bank’s commitment to educational programs, both internally and within the community, and the strategic development of its ESG policies.
In alignment with international best practices, Acba is set to launch its proprietary "green credit issuance documents," establishing clear criteria for green credits and mechanisms for CO2 emission calculations.
The bank has also established a Green Bond Framework, ensuring that funds are exclusively allocated to financing green projects. Furthermore, Acba will release a comprehensive sustainability report, detailing the social, economic, and environmental impact of the bank's activities.
Throughout its operations, Acba has received high praise for its effective management practices and its dedication to supporting social and environmental initiatives. From its inception, Acba bank has prioritized the balanced development of communities. With 44 of its 65 branches located across 10 regions of Armenia, nearly 50% of the bank's credit portfolio is dedicated to regional areas.
Acba is also a key player in sustainable development programs across Armenia, particularly in financing green economies and energy-efficient projects. In 2011, the bank partnered with the International Finance Corporation (IFC) to implement a "Social and Environmental Risk Management" system, continuing to support ESG-compliant financing activities.
Acba bank is the sole founder and 100% shareholder of Acba Leasing, Armenia's first leasing organization, where green financing constitutes over 40% of the leasing portfolio. Additionally, the bank co-founded "Amundi-Acba Asset Management" with the leading European asset management firm, Amundi. With a presence in all regions of Armenia through its 65 branches and approximately 5,600 shareholders, Acba bank stands as a leader in promoting and financing sustainable development within the country.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/franchising.title_en: Franchising: New opportunities  for business expansion
https://www.acba.am/en/news/franchising.content_en:
Within the framework of the Acba Business Club, representatives of the business community gathered to talk about the important topic for business: the advantages of franchising, the risks in the field, and the key issues of creating a franchise from scratch.
 
Acba Business Club initiated the meeting in cooperation with the Franchising Association of Armenia. The purpose is to introduce franchising to businessmen, which provides an opportunity to localize ready-made business models with a comprehensive risk assessment, expanding their own in the international market.
 
The guest of the Acba Business Club event was Viktor Lyashevsky, an international expert in franchising, a member of the board of the RA Franchising Association, who has implemented more than 200 franchising projects during his 15 professional years.
 
"The Armenian market is in a period of super growth and will continue to be so in the coming years. Businessmen, understanding the prospects of the market, can approach franchising more intelligently and create models that will have long-term, stable development," said Viktor Lyashevsky, an international franchising expert and member of the board of the RA Franchising Association.
 
Franchising presents a chance for businesses to grow in Armenia and internationally, as well as for established companies to broaden their scope and minimize risks while gaining assistance in growing their business, stated Armine Tumanyan, head of Acba bank's non-financial services team.
 
"Acba Business Club does very important work, it unites the Armenian business community and cooperates with various companies and associations, which, as a result, gives a synergy effect, which is extremely important," said Artur Vardanyan, president of the Franchising Association in the RA.
 
 
Acba is the first in the banking system to establish a business club in this format to develop entrepreneurship and create a new business culture, uniting the Armenian business community and becoming an important platform for exchanging experience and discussing business topics.
 
Under the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers are allowed to acquire new knowledge and tools necessary for management, establish new business connections, and also to become members of the business community. use the possibilities of the sme.acba.am online business platform,
make their own products more recognizable by participating in the "Made by our partners" project.
Acba Business Club is a platform that enables SME managers to establish new business contacts, participate in thematic events, be in the focus of business events, as well as take advantage of special offers provided by partner organizations.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/aznavour-con.title_en: World premiere: Symphonic performances of Aznavour's music are now available
https://www.acba.am/en/news/aznavour-con.content_en:
In collaboration with Acba bank, the "Hayastan" All-Armenian Fund, and the State Symphony Orchestra of Armenia, a grand premiere was held to debut symphonic performances of the beloved songs of Charles Aznavour, the world-famous chansonnier and national hero of Armenia, on his 100th anniversary.
 
As part of the premiere, for the first time, the Armenian State Symphony Orchestra and the world-famous cellist Kamil Toma performed Aznavour's works, which were recorded under the world-famous Deutsche Grammophon label.
 
Aznavour's music runs through my veins. I grew up listening to his music at home, and when I was studying in Germany, I would immerse myself in Aznavour's and Edith Piaf's songs with my headphones on. His lyrics tell stories that resonate with me deeply. When I perform, I can feel his presence and envision the legendary artist right before me," shared the renowned cellist Camille Thoma.
 
The project was financed with funds generated from non-cash payments made by more than 250,000 Visa “BARERAR” cardholders of Acba bank, from which the bank directs funds to the special account of “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund at the expense of its profit.
 
"It’s easy to be charitable with Acba bank, just use Acba bank's Visa “BARERAR” Card, make payments with it, and the bank will transfer certain amounts to the "Hayastan" All-Armenian Fund at the expense of its income," said Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy CEO for Business Operations at Acba bank.
 
"We have established two projects dedicated to the 100th anniversary of Charles Aznavour. The first project involved the release of the "Aznavuriana" album, while the second project is this special concert. Today marks a significant event in the cultural life of Armenia. We are representing not only the symphony orchestra, Acba bank, and “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund, but also the entire Republic of Armenia," stated Haykak Arshamyan, the executive director of “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund. 
 
"Through this initiative, we have successfully integrated Charles Aznavour's legacy into instrumental culture. It is a remarkable achievement to have our work acknowledged by prestigious institutions like 'Deutsche Gramophone', which helps to elevate our international presence," emphasized Sergey Smbatyan, the Founder, Artistic Director, and Principal Conductor of the Armenian State Symphony Orchestra.
 
"This initiative is important to present Charles Aznavour as a composer. His melodies are played on the cello, which is known to be the closest instrument to the human voice," said Sargis Balbabyan, director of the Armenian State Symphony Orchestra.
 
 
For more than ten years, Acba bank transferred around 700 million drams to the special account of the “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund. The accumulated funds are used to implement various projects, from education to culture and renewable energy.
 
Recordings were made in Paris and Yerevan to present Aznavour's legacy with symphonic instrumentation. Guest artists also participated in the creation of the album.
 
The album is available on Deutsche Grammophon's official website and on all popular music platforms.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/acba-busines.title_en: Marketing in Business Management. Acba Business Club
https://www.acba.am/en/news/acba-busines.content_en:
In the Acba Business Club, businessmen discussed the role of marketing in business and the opportunities provided by it, created a marketing strategy model, as well as established new business connections and discussed new business ideas.
 
The guest of Acba Business Club is Magda Markosyan, the founder-director of "MAROG" company, specialist in marketing communication and management, who identified the trends and models of the industry with the members of Acba Business Club, and talked about the features of marketing.
 
"One of the aspects of this meeting is that the entrepreneurs have developed a marketing strategy for a "test" business and will apply the acquired knowledge to their oun businesses. After each meeting, we have new partnerships and collaborations - businesses have the opportunity to expand ties, as well as to further transform the ideas generated during the discussions into new business ideas," stated Armine Tumanyan, lead of Non-Financial Service team at Acba bank.
"Marketing is the driving force of business, and if we don't look at it from a management and strategic point of view, we will face continuous recurring problems. Our goal is to understand what problems each organization faces from its point of view, what goals it has, and what strategy should be developed within its framework. Acba Business Club is a good example of community building and I believe that this format can have a big impact in the field in two or three years and will solve big problems," said Magda Markosyan, founder and director of “MAROG” marketing company.
