https://www.acba.am/en/news/1719302071.title_en: Special program in Vayots Dzor: 2 schools will become energy independent
https://www.acba.am/en/news/1719302071.content_en:
With the cooperation of Acba bank, Hayastan All-Armenian Fund and the UN World Food Program, solar plants will be installed on the roofs of two schools in Shatin and Aghavnadzor communities of Vayots Dzor, as a result of which the schools will save 5 million drams annually. With the saved funds, children from the first to fourth grades of the mentioned schools will receive free meals.
The program is implemented with funds generated from non-cash payments made by Visa Charitable cardholders, which Acba bank directs at its own expense to the special account of the Hayastan All-Armenian Fund.
"It is very important for children from school age to see the results of the savings created by the introduction of the latest technologies. With this project, we will solve two problems in schools: schools will become energy-saving and a high educational system will be formed there. The studies carried out by the UN World Food Program show that the higher the quality of children's food, the higher the quality of their education," said Narek Asatryan, head of public relations team at Acba bank.
 
"This is an interesting initiative, within the framework of which solar plants will help schools save money and spend money on food for schoolchildren. There is a lot of sun in Armenia and solar energy can help - all this is great," said Nanna Skau, director of the UN World Food Program office in Armenia.
 
"This is a very good program implemented by the World Food Program. The Foundation, being an advocate of alternative energy and emphasizing the development of communities, was very happy to be included in this collaboration. The program is implemented with the funds formed from the transactions made by the Visa Charitable Card holders jointly issued by Acba bank and the Hayastan All-Armenian Fund," said Zaruhi Aznauryan, head of Program and External Relationship Department at Hayastan All-Armenian Fund.
 
More details in the video.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/yerewinedays.content_en:
For the third year in a row, with the support of Acba bank, the "YereWine days" festival was organized in Yerevan, where the best winemakers, sommeliers, and just wine lovers of Armenia gathered in one place.
 
The festival's main purpose is to present the work of Armenian winemakers to the world, as well as promote exports and presentation of local products on international platforms and the development of tourism.
 
"It is already the 3rd year we have supported the "Yerevan Wine Days" event. This festival has become a unique holiday for our capital city, allowing us to present our partner, Visa international payment system. Such events help small and medium producers to enter the market and present their products," said Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy CEO for Coordination of Business Functions at Acba bank.
 
"Compared to the last year, the number of participating winemakers has increased by 12, reaching 87. Since 2019, Acba bank has been on the side of "Yerevan Wine Days" and that partnership has turned into a company. We understand the important goal we are working towards. We can say that it is also thanks to this cooperation that the "Yerevan Wine Days" are so large-scale," said Mary Badalyan, co-founder and director of the "EventTura" company.
 
The development of agriculture, winemaking and tourism in Armenia is of strategic importance for Acba Bank.
 
In 2023, the festival had 120,000 visitors. Every year the number of participants increases by about 30%. People from the CIS, European countries, the United States, Canada, Australia and many other countries come to participate in the "Yerevan Wine Days" festival.
 
More details in the video.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/bug-bounty.title_en: The Bug Bounty competition was held in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/bug-bounty.content_en:
The Bug Bounty competition was held in Armenia with the participation of more than fifty cyber security specialists.
 
The purpose of the competition is to identify the vulnerabilities of the digital system of the public sector andacba digitaland to prevent cyber and financial crimes.
 
"Our hackers are trying to find flaws in our  acba digital application. They should find the vulnerabilities that we have not discovered until now, this will only improve the security of our system," said Vagharshak Iskandaryan, head of the information security department at Acba bank.
 
"Before starting the competition, we defined "don'ts" that the participants should be guided by. The goal is to find and fix the vulnerabilities that Turkish and Azerbaijani hackers, as well as various mercenaries, are looking for 24/7. For the participants, this is also a way to earn money and improve the experience," said Ruben Muradyan, referee of the cyber security of the Bug Bounty competition.
 
At the end of the competition, the participants did not find any vulnerabilities in the acba digital system that could endanger customer data.
 
Participants who find vulnerabilities during the Bug Bounty contest are rewarded according to their severity.
 
More details in the video.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/cybergen.title_en: "CYBERGEN": A Cyber Security Conference Took Place in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/cybergen.content_en:
The Central Bank of Armenia has been hosting the "CYBERGEN" cyber security conference for three years. This event brings together a multitude of information technology and cyber security experts as well as representatives from numerous global companies.
 
The main objective of the conference is to enhance the sharing of knowledge, skills, and experience among young professionals in the cyber security field.
This year, Acba bank is also one of the sponsors of the "CYBERGEN" conference, which has always emphasized the protection and preservation of customer's personal data.
"Our main objective is to ensure the financial well-being of our clients, and Acba bank dedicates significant resources towards this goal. We are proud to be the only bank in the financial sector that holds the ISO 27701 certification for personal data management. This certification verifies that our customers' data is stored and processed according to the highest international standards," stated Vagharshak Iskandaryan, head of the IT department at Acba bank OJSC.
 
"Representatives of private and state organizations of Armenia and 15 countries of the world have come together to strengthen our financial and government systems against potential cyber attacks.It is important to note that technologies are not perfect and there may be defects; there cannot be absolutely perfect technologies today and in the future, so such events are of great importance for moving forward and developing," said Komitas Stepanyan, Director of Technology and Cybersecurity at the Central Bank of Armenia.
 
 
At the end of the conference, the invited hacker teams participated in the "Bug Bounty" competition, during which they tried to access and find vulnerabilities in various systems.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/sme-support.title_en: Acba Bank will Support the Development of SMEs in European and Asian Markets
https://www.acba.am/en/news/sme-support.content_en:
Acba bank has joined the Asian Development Bank's "Trade and Supply Chain" financial program.
 
Through this collaboration, Acba bank will provide SMEs in Armenia with access to the Bank's trade financing solutions for importing goods, helping them expand their businesses in international markets, particularly in Europe and Asia.
 
"We are delighted that Acba bank is becoming a part of the Asian Development Bank's Trade and Supply Chain Financing Program. This collaboration will open up new avenues for the growth of SMEs in Armenia," stated Hakob Andreasyan, Chief Executive Officer at Acba bank OJSC.
 
"We are excited about the cooperation with Acba bank. This partnership once again emphasizes our commitment and efforts towards global trade and economic growth. This is extremely important to ensure the economic growth and stability of SMEs in Armenia," said Suzanne Gabouri, Director General of the Private Sector Operations Department of the Asian Development Bank.
 
"Acba bank is one of the largest banks in Armenia. Being the absolute leader in financing the country's rural sector and emphasizing lending to SMEs, Acba bank has always supported the construction of a stable, innovative and competitive economy," said Steven Beck, Head of the Trade and Supply Chain Financing Program of the Asian Development Bank.
 
Established in 1966, the Asian Development Bank has been dedicated to promoting the economic growth and sustainability of the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout its history, the bank has worked tirelessly to eliminate poverty and improve the well-being of the region's residents.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/nabu-2024.title_en: The "Organic Agriculture Development" 2024-2025 free program launch
https://www.acba.am/en/news/nabu-2024.content_en:
Acba bank and the Armenian branch of the Nature And Biodiversity Conservation Union (NABU) are launching the 2024-2025 free "Organic Agriculture Development" program.
 
Within the framework of the competition, the organizations, farmers and agriculturists recognized as winners will receive organic food producer certification through the joint financial and technical support of Acba bank and NABU Armenian branch and greatly increase the prospects of exporting products.
Businessmen interested in participating in the 2024-2025 competition of the "Organic Agriculture Development" program can fill out the application formuntil June 10.
 
Businesses who produce organic food or are ready to switch to the latter can apply for the program.
In case of questions, please call at (+374) 44 599949.
 
In order to promote the development of organic agriculture in Armenia and support the producers of the sector, the joint free program "Organic Agricultural Development" of Acba bank and the Armenian branch of the Nature And Biodiversity Conservation Union (NABU) has been launched since 2015.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/ebrd-sme.title_en: Acba Bank will Allocate 50 Million Euros to the Development of SMEs in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/ebrd-sme.content_en:
Acba bank, in collaboration with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), will provide 50 million euros to the financing and development of SMEs in Armenia.
 
Within the framework of cooperation, the EBRD is introducing a new financial tool in Armenia. For the first time  in the country, the EBRD will share the risk of loan repayments provided by the financial institution. Specifically, the EBRD is willing to shoulder up to 50% of the financial risks associated with the 50 million euros allocated by Acba bank for the support and growth of SMEs. This partnership is expected to enable a broader scope of financial assistance to SMEs in Armenia.
 
EBRD President Odile Renaud-Basso highlighted that Acba bank is the first partner through which EBRD is initiating this project from Mongolia to Europe.
 
In addition, businesses operating in Armenia receiving financing within the framework of this cooperation will also have the opportunity to use special consulting services that will help them develop in foreign markets.
 
"Acba bank has a 25-year history of collaboration with EBRD. Today, we have signed an agreement that allows us to offer loans following our standard procedures while sharing the risk with EBRD at 50%. This will give the bank the opportunity to conduct a more extended credit policy, from which SMEs will also benefit," said Hakob Andreasyan, Chief Executive Officer at Acba bank OJSC.
 
"Today we signed a cooperation agreement with our esteemed partner Acba bank. The agreement focuses on a unique product aimed at strengthening capital, increasing financing for local SMEs and facilitating local currency financing for them. This collaboration will not only benefit Acba bank but also have a positive impact on rural areas and SMEs. In fact, that is the main purpose of this product. As you know, It is in line with EBRD's mission: to promote SME financing in the region" said George Orlov, responsible for Central Asia and the Caucasus region at EBRD.
 
The agreement was signed during the annual business conference of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, which brings together senior EBRD officials, representatives of the financial world and business leaders under one roof to discuss and solve global financial problems.
 
Acba bank is one of the leaders of the Armenian banking system, the absolute leader in financing the rural sector. Acba bank and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development have been cooperating since 2003 and have a history of cooperation of more than 20 years.
 
To date, the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development has invested more than 2 billion euros in 207 projects in Armenia.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/unionpay.title_en: UnionPay International cards are now being issued in Armenia for the first time.
https://www.acba.am/en/news/unionpay.content_en:
Acba bank is the first in Armenia to launch the issuance of UnionPay Gold and UnionPay Business international cards of China's largest UnionPay International payment system.
 
With UnionPay International cards, transactions can now be conducted in 183 countries around the world, about 100 of which also issue UnionPay cards. As a result of the cooperation of Acba bank and UnionPay International, Armenia has also been added to the list of these countries.
 
Acba bank issues UnionPay International cards to both resident and non-resident individuals as well as legal entities.
 
The pre-sale of UnionPay Gold and UnionPay Business cards starts from May 7, and in case of ordering before June 7, the annual service of the cards will be free for the first year.
 
The advantages of UnionPay Gold and UnionPay Business international cards are:
Making payments and withdrawals worldwide,
Credit line opportunity,
The possibility to attach a card of another payment system as an additional card,
The possibility of ordering a card through the  acba digital  application,
Free card delivery throughout the entire territory of Armenia.
UnionPay International (UPI) is a subsidiary of China UnionPay. The Acba bank started its cooperation with UnionPay International in 2019, becoming the first bank in Armenia to offer UnionPay card services. Currently, there are more than 230 million UnionPay cardholders in the world.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/bonds-24.content_en:
Acba bank has announced a public offering of non-registered bonds with a total amount of USD 5,000,000 (five million) and AMD 3,000,000,000 (three billion).
In the case of USD, the annual yield on the bonds is 4.50% and in the case of AMD, it is 9.50%.
The maturity of the bonds is 30 months, the distribution will commence on May 2, 2024, and continue until August 1.
In the case of AMD, the nominal value of a bond is AMD 100,000 (one hundred thousand), and in the case of USD, it is USD 100 (one hundred).
In order to purchase bonds, the investor must complete and submit a bond purchase application to Acba bank.
 
Bond purchase application for individuals:
Application for purchase of AMD bonds
Application for purchase of USD bonds
Bond purchase application for legal entities:
Application for purchase of AMD bonds
Application for purchase of USD bonds
According to the RA Law "On Guaranteeing the Compensation of Bank Deposits of Individuals", funds involved in nominal bonds issued by the bank are considered guaranteed bank deposits and are guaranteed by the "Deposit Guarantee Fund".

https://www.acba.am/en/news/business-cou.title_en: Free Business Courses to Support SME Growth in Regional Areas
https://www.acba.am/en/news/business-cou.content_en:
Acba bank offers business courses in Yerevan and across Armenia's regions to support the development of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).
In Tavush Province, Acba bank recently presented to the businessmen the ways and tools to competently conduct business in crisis and unstable situations as well as the development opportunities were discussed with the businessmen.
"Acba bank always prioritizes balanced development across all regions of Armenia and pays special attention to business development and job creation. Acba bank also conducts business courses of the same quality and volume in regions as in Yerevan. This is our way of demonstrating our responsibility to the people who live in the regions. We have business courses on different topics, but the goal of all of them is the same: to help develop business, to promote innovation, to use new ways of doing business and technologies, because we are sure that innovation is the key to success in today's business landscape. For regional businesses, innovation is much more important, because it empowers them to outpace competitors and achieve new heights. That's precisely why our business courses are in high demand across the regions," said Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy CEO for Business Operations at Acba bank.
Acba bank offers free business courses to all representatives of the business sector. For over ten years, more than 2300 representatives of management staff from more than 1100 organizations in Yerevan and different regions of Armenia have participated in about 150 business courses.
Acba bank is the first in the banking sector in Armenia to organize free business courses to support business development in the country. Find out free business courses of Acba bank, as well as upcoming events, through the website sme.acba.am.
For more details watch the video:

https://www.acba.am/en/news/aznavour.title_en: Charles Aznavour's Timeless Music Will Soon Conquer the World Anew
https://www.acba.am/en/news/aznavour.content_en:
Thanks to the collaboration between Acba bank, “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund, and the Armenian State Symphony Orchestra, we will soon have the opportunity to experience a symphonic performance of the most beloved compositions by the legendary Armenian chansonist Charles Aznavour.
The Armenian State Symphony Orchestra will present the famous and popular compositions of Charles Aznavour under the label of the world famous Deutsche Grammophon, the oldest record company in the world with about 126 years of history, as well as a unique album dedicated to Aznavour’s 100th anniversary.
The project of international importance to present Aznavour's cultural heritage to the world in a new and unique way, in cooperation with the “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund, was financed by the non-cash payments made by Acba bank Visa “Barerar” cardholders, which the bank directs to the special account of the “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund at its own expense.
"For the 100th anniversary of the legendary Armenian Charles Aznavour, a series of events has commenced in Armenia, including a significant event. The Armenian State Symphony Orchestra will perform the works of Charles Aznavour in a new way. I would like to thank all Acba bank Visa “Barerar” cardholders who indirectly participate in the financing of such projects," said Hakob Andreasyan, Chief Executive Officer at Acba bank OJSC.
Aznavour was a Board of Trustees member of “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund from 1992 until his death. This initiative is not only music, it creates additional value; we are at the top of the music scene, and this album will be spread all over the world by all possible means," noted Haykak Arshamyan, executive director of “Hayastan” All-Armenian Fund.
"It is a great responsibility and honor to present Armenian composer Charles Aznavour at Deutsche Grammophon. This is a great achievement for our art and Aznavour's legacy, because we represent an artist we are proud of. Charles Aznavour is an Armenian composer-author who has motivated generations. This project brought together like-minded people. I am grateful to “Hayastan” Pan-Armenian Fund and Acba bank, who stood by the initiative in a very short period of time, we needed it very much and with this project we will have an international quality product," noted Sergey Smbatyan, the Artistic Director and Chief Conductor of the Armenian State Symphony Orchestra.
Charles Aznavour's album will be released on all music platforms as a special gift to the world on his birthday, May 22.
International artists were involved in the recording processes of the album. The soloist of the project is the famous French cellist Camille Thomas, who transferred the Aznavourian energy to the works with her symphony orchestra. The wife of the 23rd President of France, Nicolas Sarkozy, Carla Bruni is also one of the artists invited to the recording.
Among the artists invited to participate in the recording processes was Carla Bruni, the wife of the 23rd French President Nicolas Sarkozy.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/business-bre.title_en: How to Position Your Personal Branding in the Business Sphere
https://www.acba.am/en/news/business-bre.content_en:
The special guest of the meeting was Armen Avag Avagyan, co-founder of "Hexact" company, marketer, author of many successful advertising projects, who discussed the topic "Man-brand" with members of Acba Business Club. Together with Armen we explored how professionals can position their personal brand and "self" within the business sphere, as well as present oneself properly and become more noticeable.
"Today, the topic of marketing is more than relevant. Any company has a problem of positioning itself, increasing its sales, forming new markets and attracting new target customers. After each training, we receive feedback from Acba Business Club participants, we ask them about their expectations, what they would like to hear, what they expect from us, so that we can provide them with what they want," commented Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy CEO for Coordination of Business Functions at Acba Bank.
"In the 21st century’s marketing landscape, building an audience and branding yourself is crucial. Who you speak to, what you say, and how you say it all hold immense weight. I welcome meetings and business clubs with a similar format like this one and thank Acba for giving me this opportunity. As the saying goes, “Together we can move the mountains.' This format is a key element to achieving that”, said Armen Avag Avagyan, co-founder of "Hexact" company.
In the banking system, Acba is the first to unite the business community in this format, creating a new culture and partnership relations. In addition to financial services, it is important for the bank to create additional value for the economy and support businessmen.
Businessmen can join the Acba Business Club through the website sme.acba.am where they will also get to know upcoming events and special offers for partners.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/afra.title_en: Acba Bank and the Franchising Association Signed a Memorandum
https://www.acba.am/en/news/afra.content_en:
Acba bank and the Franchising Association of Armenia (AFRA) have signed a memorandum of cooperation within the framework of Acba Business Club. According to the memorandum, Acba bank and the Franchising Association of Armenia will cooperate on the development and diversification of business activities of the member organizations of Acba Business Club.
Within the framework of the memorandum, Acba Business Club members will have the opportunity to participate in open franchising-related seminars with the participation of international speakers organized by the Franchising Association of Armenia, and will also receive support in participating in international thematic exhibitions and various events.
The collaboration is set to include initiatives specifically designed to foster the growth of women's entrepreneurship, focusing on the dissemination of new knowledge and skills.
 
As part of the cooperation between Acba bank and the Franchising Association of Armenia, the members of Acba Business Club will also be able to use the support and full monitoring of the franchise selection, full branding, as well as the membership of the Franchising Association under special conditions.
Under the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers now have the opportunity to acquire new knowledge and tools necessary for management, establish new business connections, and also become members of the business community. Within the framework of the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers can:
attend free business courses,
become a member of Acba Business Club,
use the possibilities of the sme.acba.am online business platform,
make their own products more recognizable by participating in the "Made by our partners" project.
Acba Business Club is a platform that enables SME managers to establish new business connections, participate in thematic events, be in the focus of business events, as well as take advantage of special offers provided by partner organizations.
Acba Business Club is the beginning of new perspectives and opportunities for businesses.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/head-office-.title_en: Acba Bank Will Have a New Head Office
https://www.acba.am/en/news/head-office-.content_en:
The new head office of Acba bank is being constructed using unique architectural solutions, Armenian style, while keeping high international standards.
The office will consist of 7 floors and will have an area of about 13 thousand square meters.
The project owner and sponsor is the bank's main shareholder Acba Federation. The Italian Renko company will maintain the construction organization.
“This strategic location was acquired 18 years ago by the bank’s former CEO, the late Mr. Gishyan, who had the vision of establishing a new head office. Ideally situated at the “gateway” to Yerevan when coming from the airport, this land was chosen to build the bank's new head office. With the construction of this new office, we have a message for our generations that we should all be anchored in our homeland and build the future and personal happiness in our country. I assure you, wherever you go, there is no better city than Yerevan, there is no better country than Armenia, there are no better people than the Armenian people," said Hakob Andreasyan, Chief Executive Officer at Acba bank OJSC.
"This project is Renko's biggest project implemented in Armenia. We approached it with great responsibility, we understand how important it is for the bank’s future. Our designers worked with the bank's team and we tried to combine modern approaches with Armenian elements. Renko has been in Armenia for 20 years. We have implemented various projects, but this building will be unique and meet all international environmental standards," said Andrea Dellasanta, General Director at Renko Armenia.
"The project launched 4 years ago. We presented the concept to the bank's management - our goal was to have a unique building. After long discussions, this project emerged, which has a soul in it. The building complies with the international LEED certification, it is the first building of this level in Armenia, all environmental rules have been observed, from water and energy saving to air quality and green zones creation," said Guido De Novellis, Chief Architect of the project.
Acba bank is one of the leaders of the Armenian banking system, the absolute leader in financing the country's rural sector. After the initial public offering (IPO) in 2021, Acba bank has more than 5,800 shareholders. Thanks to the implementation of the latest digital solutions and the use of new technologies, the bank continuously develops the quantity and quality of the provided financial services. Acba is represented in all regions of Armenia, has 65 branches, and is considered one of the largest employers in the financial system and the country.
Acba Federation is the only significant shareholder of Acba bank, holding more than 81% of the bank's shares. Thanks to its participation in Acba bank, Acba Federation contributes to the development of agriculture, small and medium-sized businesses in rural areas, development of communities, revitalization and development of the business environment in rural areas and communities, and the growth of the well-being of every person carrying out business activities in these areas.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/fitch-bb.content_en:
The prestigious international rating agency Fitch (Fitch Ratings) raised Acba bank's B+ rating “Long-Term Issuer Default Rating IDR” to "BB-", and the Viability Rating (VR) from "b+" to "bb-".
Fitch emphasized that Acba bank's rating upgrade is due to sustained, significant improvements in the bank's profitability and capitalization during 2022-2023. According to Fitch, this is mainly caused by the rapid economic growth in Armenia.
The report published by Fitch also mentions the improvement in the quality of the bank's credit portfolio as well as the level of solvency.
According to Fitch's forecast, the profitability of Acba bank will increase due to the favorable operating environment.
During 2023, Acba bank recorded significant results:
Generating 28.6 billion AMD profit, the company also achieved remarkably high levels of profitability for both its assets at 3.9%, and its capital at 23.6%.
18.6% growth of the deposit portfolio,
an increase in the number of cards, with around 35,300 cards, occupying the first position in the market,
About 44% increase in the volume of transactions made with POS-terminals compared to the previous period.
paid a dividend to its shareholders in the amount of AMD 4.4 billion.
In addition, the bank's assets increased by 17.8% and the capital increased by 21.8%.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/arm-state-so.title_en: The State Song Theater has received a new lease of life
https://www.acba.am/en/news/arm-state-so.content_en:
In 1994, composer, People's Artist of Armenia, Artur Grigoryan founded the State Song Theater.
3 decades after its establishment, the State Song Theater was renovated and equipped with modern sound and light capabilities, and innovative equipment, while preserving the unique style of the founder, maestro Artur Grigoryan.
Acba bank and Visa BENEFACTOR card holders became partners of the State Song Theater. Within the framework of the program, Acba bank donates 0.1% of the amount of all payment transactions made with Visa BENEFACTOR cards, as well as 50% of the card service fee, from its profits to the special account of Hayastan All-Armenian Fund. Cardholders simply perform transactions, from which the bank directs the profit to charity at its own expense.
"It was top priority for us to reopen such a theater that would be suitable for today's audience, who sees everything. We never had the audio equipment that we have today. Stages, chairs, tables, floor, mirrors... We did everything as our art director Artur Grigoryan wanted. It was very difficult when giving the second pulse, there were few people by my side, I was alone. Thankfully, I reached out to Acba bank and they came through for us, supporting the State Song Theater and enabling us to carry on the work of the esteemed RA People's Artist Artur Grigoryan. I am truly grateful to Acba bank," said Mane Grigoryan, director of the State Song Theater.
The reopened theater with the preservation of old traditions and innovative solutions continues to educate generations, to present good music to the audience and stage new musical performances.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/yerevan-wine.title_en: Acba bank will sponsor the "Yerevan Wine Days" festival until 2027
https://www.acba.am/en/news/yerevan-wine.content_en:
Acba bank will continue staying the main sponsor of the "Yerevan Wine Days" festival for another 3 years.
Within the framework of the festival, this year a more complete program is planned: tasting of Armenian wines, a large display of local dishes, and special guests.
"We are taking steps to help make the field of event tourism in Armenia more attractive. Armenia must have a wine festival that is renowned and eagerly anticipated by individuals who mark it in their calendars and make plans to attend. There are not many festivals in Armenia, but this and several such successful festivals inspire hope that we will have a country rich in festival entertainment that will attract not only Armenians but also visitors from around the world" commented Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy CEO (Business Operations) at Acba bank OJSC.
"Since 2019, Acba bank has been the main sponsor of "Yerevan Wine Days". And within these years, both the growth and development of the festival are visible for everyone. The scale of the festival is increasing and we believe that it is also thanks to the cooperation with Acba bank. Having confidence in this cooperation, we take bold steps every year to make the festival even more large-scale," said Mary Badalyan, co-founder and director of "EventTura" company.
It is expected that the number of festival guests will exceed 200,000 this year. Many tourists, when visiting Armenia, specially choose the festival days for tasting the wine of Armenian endemic varieties and getting acquainted with the local gastronomic heritage.
Acba bank emphasizes the development of event tourism, viticulture, and winemaking in Armenia. The bank is doing its best to make event tourism another stimulus for economic development.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/charity.title_en: Acba bank initiated 4 charity programs for the children of Artsakh
https://www.acba.am/en/news/charity.content_en:
Acba bank wraps up the year with 4 charity programs dedicated to assisting  the children and youth of Artsakh.
Rather than organizing a festive event, the Acba team joined around one idea: to support children in need.
The first program is aimed at children's health. With the support of Acba bank, the “Health Fund for Children of Armenia” will purchase all the medicine necessary for urgent treatment for more than 100 children forcibly displaced from Artsakh.
With the second program, Acba supports the “City of Smile” charitable foundation. With the support of the bank, 2 children diagnosed with cancer will receive complete treatment.The third program focuses on education: "Tumo for Artsakh youth". The bank will support Artsakh youth aged 12-18 to discover their potential in the field of information technology with the help of Tumo.
With the fourth program, Acba presents a New Year's tale to the children of Artsakh: about 1,500 children will attend the New Year's musical at the State Song Theater of Armenia.
Each employee at Acba bank participates in these initiatives, with the hope that the children will experience a small celebration, inspiration, and the faith that everything will turn out alright.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/cop-28.content_en:
The COP conference is currently the largest platform in the world, which annually gathers world leaders, environmentalists, financial and non-financial institutions under its roof to discuss and find solutions to environmental problems.
Environmental protection has been an integral part of Acba bank's strategy for years, and the bank works to raise awareness among a wide range of people and also implements various policies to support nature conservation in its daily operations.
Within the framework of its strategy, the bank considers the implementation of the UN's "Sustainable Development" goals as a priority, being convinced that the banking system has a key role in the sustainable development of the natural surroundings and social environment.
Today, the Bank continues to work with its international partners on environmental issues in order to develop more systematic approaches that are measurable, more controllable and visible to the public and, above all, to involve the public in solving this very important problem through their daily behavior.
Saving nature is not a solemn event. You and I save nature with small steps every day.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/helens-food.title_en: Organic fruit bar production established in Gyumri
https://www.acba.am/en/news/helens-food.content_en:
Strong immune system, abundance of energy and strength - the source is Armenian organic fruit bars produced in Gyumri. The production was founded by Ashot Israelyan, who returned from Russia and decided to set up a business in his homeland.
These organic fruit bars are made by grinding dried fruit. They also add combined flavors that replace sweets for children.
“‘Helen's Food’, a company that produces organic fruit bars, has been granted organic certification within the framework of the annual "Development of Organic Agriculture" program, carried out by Acba bank and the German Nature Protection Union (NABU).
"Armenian fruits are the best, that's why the idea came to initiate such a production. We came to Armenia, found experts and started the work by exerting our own efforts," says Ashot Israelyan, founder of "Helen's Food" company.
"Helen’s Food" company, with the support of Acba bank and NABU, participates in exhibitions and connects with individuals who share similar interests.
More details are in the video.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/express-netw.title_en: Solutions for business development in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/express-netw.content_en:
At Acba Business Club, businessmen from different sectors discuss and map the problems that hinder business development in Armenia.
The Acba Business Club format is unique in the financial system of Armenia: the bank needs to support the business community and create a knowledge-based business environment.
"Here we have the opportunity to engage with our partners and they have the opportunity to communicate with other partners, establish business connections, get to know each other's businesses, and stay updated on industry developments," said Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy CEO for Coordination of Business Functions at Acba bank OJSC.
"The focus of today's meeting is on the problems the business community is facing and the obstacles they encounter in their activities. By engaging in discussions with our partners, we aim to highlight the obstacles that prevent them from moving forward," stated Armine Tumanyan, team lead of non-financial services at Acba bank OJSC.
At each meeting, Acba Business Club welcomes new members and fosters the establishment of new business connections and partnership relations.
Under the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers are allowed to acquire new knowledge and tools necessary for effective management, establish new business connections, and become members of the business community. Within the framework of the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers can:
attend free business courses,
become a member of Acba Business Club,
use the opportunities of the sme.acba.am online business platform,
make their products more recognizable by participating in the "Made by our partners" project.
Acba Business Club is a platform that enables SME managers to establish new business contacts, participate in thematic events, be in the focus of business events, as well as take advantage of special offers provided by partner organizations.
Acba Business Club is the beginning of new perspectives and opportunities for businesses.
More details are in the video.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/new-forest.title_en: A new forest will be planted in the Lori region
https://www.acba.am/en/news/new-forest.content_en:
The Acba bank team in Urasar village, located in the Lori region, have come together with a shared goal։ to take care of nature and create a greener country.
At first, they hiked, and after overcoming the heights of Urasar, the bank employees started planting trees. The work of reforestation and the desire to create a long-lasting forest with rich biodiversity has reunited "My Forest Armenia" organization and Acba bank. This year the Acba team planted birch trees.
Birch trees correspond to the climatic and soil conditions of Urasar, that is why this tree species with beautiful bark and leaves were chosen.
"My Forest Armenia" organization has set a new milestone: until 2025, it will plant 800,000 trees annually, as a result of which 240 hectares of new forest will be created.
"Acba bank has been emphasizing the development and preservation of the environment since the first day of its establishment. For this purpose, we gather every year to contribute to the greening of the environment," said Ani Poghosyan, talent acquisition team lead at Acba bank OJSC.
The primary objective of "My Forest Armenia" is to maximize the number of forests in Armenia by expanding forested areas. Armenia is poor in forest landscape. Together with Acba bank, which is one of our "donor" companies, we have successfully planted birch trees.
Our goal is not only to plant a forest, but also to engage the people of Armenia in this endeavor, so they understand the significance of forests," said Arpine Aleksanyan, corporate relations coordinator at "My Forest Armenia" organization.
It is already the second year that Acba bank has joined the "My Forest of Armenia" initiative: thousands of trees are planted to increase green areas.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/eu-ebrd.title_en: AMD equivalent to 10 million dollars will be allocated to the development of women's entrepreneurship in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/eu-ebrd.content_en:
Acba bank, in cooperation with the European Union and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and with the support of Sweden, has raisedfinancial resources in AMD equivalent to 10 million dollars.
Acba bank will direct the raised funds to the financing of women entrepreneurs in Armenia. Acba accumulated these funds within the framework of the "Women in Business" program.
This initiative with the European Union and the EBRD will further develop small and medium enterprises in Armenia, whose managers are women. The bank will prioritize lending to businesses located in rural areas and provide loans in the local currency.
"The new resources will empower women to take a more proactive and confident approach in their business initiatives. Acba bank has already achieved notable success in providing loans to support women's business activities - women have a fairly active role in the activities of the small and medium sector of the economy," stated Hakob Andreasyan, CEO at Acba bank OJSC.
"As a result of our long-term cooperation with Acba bank, we have successfully completed various projects.The loan agreement we have signed will be disbursed in two stages: 6 million will be provided in the first stage, and the remaining 4 million will be provided next year. The EU has also provided us with additional financial support in the form of guarantees, making our loan from Acba bank more cost-effective.
This is a multifaceted beneficial program. Acba has a good portfolio of clients, we are very happy to support Acba," said Alkis Vryenios Drakinos, EBRD's Caucasus regional head.
Acba bank has been cooperating with EBRD since 2003. To date, the EBRD has invested more than 2 billion euros in 207 projects in Armenia, supporting the development of the private sector and "green" economies.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/China-Union-.title_en: Acba bank will issue China's largest UnionPay International cards
https://www.acba.am/en/news/China-Union-.content_en:
Acba bank will issue China's largest UnionPay International payment system cards UnionPay Gold and UnionPay Business, in Armenia.
In 2019, Acba Bank initiated a partnership with UnionPay International, becoming the first bank in Armenia to offer UnionPay card services.
Cards are issued to both individuals and legal entities, whether they are residents or non-residents.
The advantages of UnionPay Gold and UnionPay Business international cards are:
Making payments and withdrawals worldwide,
Credit line facility,
The ability to attach a card from another payment system as an additional card,
The possibility of ordering a card through the acba digital platform,
Receiving a card in the entire territory of the Republic of Armenia by delivery.
UnionPay International (UPI) is a subsidiary of China UnionPay. 
UnionPay International cards are accepted for payments in 181 countries worldwide, about 80 of which also issue UnionPay cards.
Currently, there are over 200 million UnionPay cardholders in the world.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/biometric-vi.title_en: Become an Acba bank customer from anywhere in the world
https://www.acba.am/en/news/biometric-vi.content_en:
The remote identification system is now available on the acba digital platform. The new function of biometric identification makes access to financial services from anywhere in the world simple and convenient.
Within minutes, without visiting the bank, from anywhere and at any time, by registering in the acba digital system, users will have the opportunity to use the package of banking and non-banking services offered by Acba bank: open an account, make a deposit, get a loan, make transfers and payments, etc.
After downloading the acba digital application, to use the remote identification system, you need to scan your passport or ID card, and then identify your facial biometric data.
"Those who don't have an account with us will be able to download the application in a few seconds, register, and pass biometric identification at a place and time convenient for them. For example, at home, on the beach or while drinking coffee, it is now possible to authenticate and use banking services. Previously, customers were required to visit physical branches, but now they have the option to save time and avoid standing in queues or getting stuck in traffic. Users can simply arrange for their registration to be done at a location of their choice," stated Artur Karchikyan, the Head of the Digital Business Department at Acba bank OJSC.
"With the introduction of remote registration with biometric identification, Acba bank has taken another step closer to its customers. What does this mean? From now on, without visiting the bank, users can become full-fledged customers with the acba digital application, order digital and other cards online, make investments, apply for credit and use all the bank's services with 24/7 access from anywhere in the world, noted Davit Brutyan, the Head of the Digital Products and Channels Department at Acba bank OJSC.
In the near future, there will be new updates on the acba digital platform, which will make financial services in Armenia even more digital, accessible and convenient.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/biometric.title_en: Remote registration system in the acba digital
https://www.acba.am/en/news/biometric.content_en:
Acba bank has implemented a biometric identification system on its acba digital platform, enabling individuals to become clients of Acba bank in just a few minutes without having to physically visit the bank.
To complete the identification, you need to scan your passport or ID card using the acba digital application, as well as to pass biometric identification of the face / "selfie", after which you will have access to all the features of acba digital, including opening an account, making deposits, getting loans, making transfers, and payments, etc.
By implementing the biometric identification system, Acba bank has taken another step towards making financial services more accessible and convenient. This technological advancement allows individuals to become bank clients and access banking services at any time and from any location, without physically visiting the bank’s branch.
In the near future, Acba bank will keep introducing innovative and convenient solutions that will not only support the growth of Armenia's economy but also enhance financial services through digital platforms and increase customer convenience.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/green.title_en: Acba bank continues to develop "green" financing instruments in Armenia
https://www.acba.am/en/news/green.content_en:
Acba bank is always focused on promoting sustainable development in Armenia. The primary objective of sustainable development is to enhance the overall quality of human life.
Since its foundation, Acba has always strived for the sustainable development of society, as a result of which the bank contributes to the development and preservation of social and physical environments in Armenia.
As a result, Acba bank continuously develops the provided financial, especially "green" financing services with innovative solutions, in favor of the development of Armenia and the Armenian economy.
Acba bank is currently undergoing a transformation process, and one of its goals is to introduce new "green" financing instruments and initiate the issuance of "green" bonds by the first quarter of 2024.
Acba also provides the opportunity to use many “green” financing tools, such as trade finance products, “green” business loans, loans for solar plants and water heaters, energy efficiency programs of the community, as well as the products of the Green leasing sub-brand of Acba Leasing, a member of the Acba financial group, from Acba Bank branches.
"Acba Bank attaches importance to the protection and development of the environment. Back in 2011, together with the International Finance Corporation (IFC), we developed and implemented a "Social and Environmental Risks" management system in lending processes. The latter is self-employed, and based on baseline data, it classifies loans according to Social and Environmental risk class. In case of violation of the latter by the borrowers, the bank "recalls" the loan. This is a clear indicator that Acba highly values social and environmental protection in Armenia. This is also a motivation for us to develop "green" financing tools continuously," said Arsen Melkonyan, Deputy Chief Executive Director for Coordination of Business Operations at Acba bank.Acba Bank is currently the only financial institution in Armenia that finances energy-saving measures of communities.The bank is consistent and emphasizes sustainable development in both internal and external functions, a vivid example of which is the new headquarters of Acba Bank under construction on Tsovakal Isakov Avenue, which is being built according to the LEED Gold standard and will be ready in 2025.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/Sebastia-bra.title_en: The 65th branch of Acba bank was launched
https://www.acba.am/en/news/Sebastia-bra.content_en:
Acba bank launched its 65th branch in “Sebastia”. The newly opened branch provides the full range of services offered by Acba Bank. 
"Acba continues to develop its branch network in order to stay closer to customers and partners. With the opening of the "Sebastia" branch, we already have 21 branches in Yerevan, and the number of our branches throughout Armenia became 65. This wide branch network makes it possible to be available throughout the country and contribute to the development of the economy. This is why we must continue to work with the logic of moving forward. In the newly opened "Sebastia" branch, all our clients and partners will be able to take advantage of the entire package of services offered by Acba," said Hakob Andreasyan, CEO at Acba bank.
In connection with the opening of the Sebastia branch, until December 29 inclusive, special conditions will apply for the following services:
For individual customers:
free Mastercard Standard and American Express Cashback cards for the entire validity period,
50% discount for the first year of Visa Signature card service (card benefits here),
30% discount for American Express Gold card service if you are a depositor of Acba bank (card benefits here).
Find the details on the bank's website.
For legal entity customers:
Visa Business card with no service commission for the first year,
In case of activation of the Soft POS application, payment card service commissions will be set at 0% for 30 calendar days following the conclusion of the contract.
Find the details on the bank's website.
The "Sebastia" branch of the bank will be open from Monday to Friday from 09:30 to 18:00 (cash register service: 09:30 to 16:30).
The "Sebastia" branch of Acba bank will operate at "80 Sebastia Street, 50 Building".

https://www.acba.am/en/news/ueict.title_en: Acba bank and UEICT signed a memorandum
https://www.acba.am/en/news/ueict.content_en:
Acba bank and the Union of Employers of Information and Communication Technologies (UEICT) have signed a memorandum of cooperation within the framework of the Acba Business Club (Acba⠀Business⠀Club), in which they will cooperate in the development of digital skills of SMEs in Armenia.
In order to develop the digital skills of SMEs, the bank and the UEICT will cooperate in three main directions:

Educating SMEs on the need for digital skills in business and for digital engagement.
As part of the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers can gain new skills and tools essential for effective management, establish new business connections, and also become members of the business community. Within the framework of the "Acba Business Partner" sub-brand, SME managers can:

become a member of Acba Business Club,
use the possibilities of the sme.acba.am online business platform,
make your own products more recognizable by participating in the "Made by our partners" project.
Acba Business Club provides an opportunity for SME managers to establish new business contacts, participate in thematic events, be in the focus of business events, as well as take advantage of special offers provided by partner organizations.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/francofest-2.title_en: "Francofest" - a new link connecting Armenian-French cultures
https://www.acba.am/en/news/francofest-2.content_en:
French books, discussions, music, theater performances... "Francofest" initiated by Newmag opens the autumn reading season.
Newmag presented 4 new bestseller books in Armenian at the first French book festival.
The partners of "Francofest" are Acba bank and Acba Leasing, which supported the organization of the event with the aim of developing Armenian-French relations and getting closer to the francophone world.
"Taking into account the effective cooperation between Acba Financial Group and Newmag, we believe that "Francofest" was a very good opportunity for another cooperation. Newmag has its big and unique contribution to the rapprochement of Armenian-French cultures. As you know, Acba Financial Group is also one of the unifiers of Armenian-French business cultures in Armenia. Therefore, we could not stay away from participating in this important event. I think it will become a good tradition in Armenia, it will leave its positive mark not only on the reader, but also on the creator," said Ofelya Saghatelyan, Head of the Marketing Department at Acba Bank OJSC.
"Armenian-French political-economic ties are very intense and have always been intense, while cultural ties are weak. The purpose of "Francofest" is first of all to take a step forward to the Francophone intelligentsia, which has always been by Armenia's side. "Francofest" comes to fill that cultural gap. It is no coincidence that one of the main partners of "Francofest" is also Acba Financial Group. We are happy that both Acba Financial Group and Newmag have the same vision: to deepen Armenian-French cultural ties, to bring French content to Armenian readers," noted Artak Aleksanyan, CEO at Newmag publishing house.
Within the framework of the festival, Acba has also prepared a surprise: students can apply at any branch of Acba bank until September 23 and receive Visa Student cards with free service for a period of 5 years.
Aznavour in Armenian language and sound, the premiere of the Armenian version of Charles Aznavour's song "Children of this fight" took place during the "Francofest".
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/france-docto.title_en: French Armenian doctors implemented a program in Shirak region
https://www.acba.am/en/news/france-docto.content_en:
Armenian doctors who came from France worked for 2 weeks at Maralik School No. 1 and examined more than 300 children, providing them with glasses as needed.
The charity program, which unites French-Armenian doctors, is called "Glasses for Armenia".
Children's examination goes through 3 stages: computer diagnosis is followed by a more detailed vision check, and the last stage is the selection of glasses. A large number of optical lenses and a wide variety of frames have been brought from France, so that the children can choose the one that they will wear with more pleasure.
The partner of the UMAF organization representing French-Armenian doctors is Acba Bank, with which cooperation has a 7-year history. Every year French-Armenian doctors, with the support of the bank, implement a free ophthalmology program for children in different regions of Armenia.
"There are many cases of astigmatism in Armenia, it is good if astigmatism is prevented at an early stage. Myopia and astigmatism are common in Armenia," said Levon Artinyan, a member of the French Medical Association and co-founder of the program․
"We always went to the villages, we never came to Yerevan, because Yerevan is a big city, it is the capital, everything is there. It is much more difficult for families in villages. That is why we have always preferred to go to villages, we have always tried to go to different villages, different regions, so that all children get glasses. Acba Bank is a very important institution for us because it has given us great support. Without the help of Acba Bank, we would not have been able to work in this way and see so many children," said Petros Ohanyan, a member of the Armenian Doctors' Union of France and co-founder of the program.
In the first phase of the project, the French-Armenian doctors trained village school nurses to be able to pre-select children who have vision problems. They worked with more than 30 nurses to carry out the necessary checks. Already selected children are helped to see the world more clearly and accurately by doctors who came from France.
This year, more than 500 elderly people have also benefited from the program, and they have also been provided with glasses.
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/EBRD-15mln.title_en: AMD equivalent to USD 15 million will be allocated to support micro, small and medium-sized businesses
https://www.acba.am/en/news/EBRD-15mln.content_en:
With the cooperation of Acba Bank, the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and the European Union (EU), AMD equivalent to USD 15 million will be allocated to the development of Armenia's economy, creating greater access to financing for micro, small and medium-sized enterprises, especially in rural areas.
The project is being implemented with the support of the EU, within the framework of the guarantee program of the European Fund for Sustainable Development (EFSD+).
"We have a very rich experience of cooperation with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, we signed the first contract back in 2003. Now we have signed a new contract aimed at supporting, promoting and financing small and medium-sized businesses, especially in rural areas," said Hakob Andreasyan, Chief Executive Officer at Acba Bank.
"EBRD is one of the largest institutional investors in Armenia, our primary goal is to focus on the private sector. We aim to provide great support to small and medium-sized enterprises, and a good way to do this is by partnering with Acba Bank. I must also emphasize the support of the European Union, because this project would not have been possible without the support of the European Fund for Sustainable Development," said Jurgen Rigterink, the first vice-president of the EBRD.
The cooperation between Acba Bank and EBRD started in 2003.
Acba is one of the leading banks in Armenia, the absolute leader in financing the agricultural sector of the country, it is the leader in the field of lending to micro, small and medium-sized enterprises. Acba is represented in all regions of Armenia, has 64 branches, and is considered one of the largest employers in the country and in the financial system.
EBRD is a leading institutional investor in Armenia. To date, the bank has invested about 2 billion euros in 206 projects in the country. The EBRD supports the development of the private sector and the transition to a sustainable, "green" economy.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/1693480322.title_en: From making dreams to setting goals
https://www.acba.am/en/news/1693480322.content_en:
The children of "SOS-Children's Villages" of Kotayk region spend their holidays in a camp in Dilijan. Children's life here is filled with many team games, which are not disturbed even by the local sun and heat.
In "SOS-Children's Villages” children receive care, upbringing and education, just like in a family. The beneficiaries are children who are socially disadvantaged or in difficult life situations.
The guest of the campers was Acba Bank, a partner of the "SOS-Children's Villages" charitable foundation, with the support of which the camp was implemented. The bank employees prepared a full program for the children, shared their own experience and inspired the children to realize their seemingly impossible dreams.
"We tried to make the day of the camp children more interesting, we planned interactive and team games for them, talked and tried to convey the idea that a dream should not remain a dream, it should become a goal and steps should be taken to achieve that goal. Together with the children, we tried to plan what steps they would take to move forward, we prepared special papers for the children to write and stick on their walls, in order to remember their dream every day and to work every day to achieve that dream," said Armine Tumanyan, the non financial services team lead at Acba bank OJSC.
Acba Bank, a partner of "SOS-Children's Villages", implemented this program with the support of Visa "BARERAR" card holders. Back in 2012, the bank issued the charity Visa "BARERAR" card for the first time in Armenia together with the “Hayastan All-Armenian Fund”. Within the framework of the program, the bank transfers 0.1% of the amount of all payment transactions made with the Visa "BARERAR" card from its profit to the fund's special account, as well as 50% of the service fee. Cardholders simply perform transactions, from which the bank directs the profit to charity at its own expense.
Acba Bank's cooperation with "SOS-Children's Villages" has a history of more than 5 years.
Watch the video for more details.
The bank is controlled by the Central Bank of Armenia.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/nabu-2023.title_en: The results of the "Development of Organic Agriculture in 2023-2024" program competition have been summed up
https://www.acba.am/en/news/nabu-2023.content_en:
Acba Bank and Germany's Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union (NABU) summed up the results of the "Development of Organic Agriculture in 2023-2024" competition program.
In the course of the competition, the prospects of applicants for the export of organic products and the growth of interest in the product in case of certification, the environmental impact of the programs, the short-term and long-term goals, motivation, and risks of the programs were taken into account.
This year, 13 SMEs and private entrepreneurs will receive certification with the support of the program.
The winners of the "Development of Organic Agriculture in 2023-2024" competition program are:
1. Narek Hovhannisyan (beekeeping)
2. Samvel Hakobyan (dried fruit production)
3. Naira Hambardzumyan (fruit cultivation)
4. Nairi Galstyan (beekeeping)
5. Suren Grigoryan (vegetable cultivation)
6. Ashot Ghazaryan (grain cultivation)
7. Vigen Mnatsakanyan (beekeeping)
8. Nerses Manukyan (beekeeping)
9. Areg Galstyan (tea production)
10. Levon Paronyan (grain cultivation)
11. Vardan Kocharyan (beekeeping)
12. Hayarpi Hakobyan (beekeeping)
13. Gohar Movsisyan (grain and vegetable cultivation)
Acba Bank together with NABU has been implementing the "Organic Agriculture Development" program since 2015. The purpose of the project is to promote the development of organic agriculture in Armenia and to support the producers of the sector.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/accountants-.title_en: Acba Bank and the Accountants Association of Armenia signed a memorandum
https://www.acba.am/en/news/accountants-.content_en:
Acba Bank and the Accountants Association of Armenia have signed a memorandum of cooperation within the framework of the Acba Business Club, by which Acba Bank and the Accountants Association of Armenia will cooperate in ensuring sector awareness, development, increasing competitiveness and protecting the interests of the beneficiaries of the Acba Business Club.
Within the framework of the memorandum, Acba Business Club members will be provided with the packages regarding legislative changes (including newly adopted legal acts)and projects developed as a result of the "Assessment of the Impact of Legislative Changes" weekly discussion organized by the expert accountants and auditors of the Accountants Association of Armenia, which will contribute to the process of conducting business more effectively for the beneficiaries of Acba Business Club.
Within the framework of the cooperation, the legal issues that hinder the entrepreneurial activity in the practice of the beneficiaries of the Acba Business Club will be collected, which will be presented in the form of improvement proposals to the state bodies carrying out administration.
Acba Bank and the accountants Association of Armenia will also organize working meetings for the beneficiaries of Acba Business Club in order to highlight problems associated with the sector and find their solutions.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/kotayq-jerma.title_en: The latest generation geothermal hydroponic greenhouse was established in Kotayk region
https://www.acba.am/en/news/kotayq-jerma.content_en:
Juicy and unique tasting tomatoes of the "Hatis Barikner" company grow in the latest generation geothermal hydroponic greenhouse occupying an area of 3600 square meters. The latter saves all resources: water, heating, cooling and electricity.
The founders of the greenhouse are friends Davit and Vahan, who previously worked in the banking sector. First, together they created a unique factory in the region, recycling plastic bottles, and then tires, resulting in fuel that is used to heat the greenhouse.
The friends distributed the work in this way: Davit deals with technical issues, Vahan deals with administrative issues. They learn everything by their own experience. When choosing the location, they took into account that the greenhouse should be on one of the sunny sides of Armenia.
The partner of "Hatis Barikner" is Acba Bank, which from the very beginning believed in the idea of creating an innovative greenhouse of two friends.
"All this would not have been possible so quickly without a reliable partner. In this respect, Acba Bank and Acba Leasing responded quickly and "shared" our innovative investment case. Not all innovations can succeed, but our partners trusted us and we continue to develop together," says Davit Karamyan, co-founder of ‘Hatis Barikner’.
Now tomatoes are consumed only in the local market. 
Watch the video for more details.

https://www.acba.am/en/news/1690975408.title_en: Acba Bank and the Investment Council of Armenia signed a memorandum
